verbs.description: criminate (third-person singular simple present criminates, present participle criminating, simple past and past participle criminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To accuse (someone) of a crime; to incriminate. [from 17th c.]
examples: ‘I am now under confinement in this place for debt; but if you obtain  […]  a condition from the judge that what I reveal shall not criminate myself, I will make discoveries that shall confound that same Marquis  […] .’

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare) To rebuke or censure (someone). [from 17th c.]
